bug.short_desc: SyntaxError: invalid syntax relstring = "Uses" if type == "using" else "Used by"

long_desc.thetext:
Hello, I'm trying to create the source for the "Hello World" app and below is the error I'm getting when trying to run generate.py
[rmartinez@RSNGEND_DEV custom]$ python generate.py Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/developers/rmartinez/qooxdoo/qooxdoo-1.2-sdk/tool/bin/generator.py", line 26, in ? from generator.Generator import Generator File "/home/developers/rmartinez/qooxdoo/qooxdoo-1.2-sdk/tool/pylib/generator/Generator.py", line 1109 relstring = "Uses" if type == "using" else "Used by" ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax [rmartinez@RSNGEND_DEV custom]$
--------------------------------- System Information: [rmartinez@RSNGEND_DEV custom]$ uname -a Linux RSNGEND_DEV.usautoparts.com 2.6.18-164.11.1.el5 #1 SMP Wed Jan 6 13:26:04 EST 2010 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
[rmartinez@RSNGEND_DEV custom]$ python Python 2.4.3 (#1, Jun 11 2009, 14:09:37) [GCC 4.1.2 20080704 (Red Hat 4.1.2-44)] on linux2 Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

@Thomas: Please check whats wrong here
@juney: What Python version do you use and what system are you working on? Did you use trunk or the 1.2 release of qooxdoo?

@Martin, I extracted the 1.2 release of qooxdoo.
Following are the environment/specs:
OS: Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 5.5 (Tikanga)
Arch: [rmartinez@RSNGEND_DEV custom]$ uname -a Linux RSNGEND_DEV.usautoparts.com 2.6.18-164.11.1.el5 #1 SMP Wed Jan 6 13:26:04 EST 2010 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
Python: [rmartinez@RSNGEND_DEV custom]$ python Python 2.4.3 (#1, Jun 11 2009, 14:09:37) [GCC 4.1.2 20080704 (Red Hat 4.1.2-44)] on linux2 Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
mass retargeting to 1.2.2 due to intermediate 1.2.1 release
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
